summary: This document is an email chain from July 24, 2019, between a Regional Director and an Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, discussing inmate Jeffrey Epstein's status. It details his removal from suicide watch to 'Psychological Observation,' his pending self-mutilation incident report, and his housing assignment. The email also contains a definition of Psychological Observation and mentions another inmate, Cesar Sayoc, who is unrelated to Epstein's case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the email chain; an inmate at MCC New York who was moved from suicide watch to psychological observation status and had a pending incident report for self-mutilation.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The sender/recipient of emails providing updates on inmate Epstein's status, housing, and medical assessments to the Regional Director.

persons.name: Regional Director Northeast Region
persons.context: The recipient/sender of emails requesting and receiving daily updates on inmate Epstein's status, housing, and the meaning of 'Psychological Observation.'

persons.name: Cesar Sayoc
persons.context: Mentioned in the email as an inmate who pleaded guilty to mailing explosive devices and is housed in the SHU; used as an example of another inmate's housing situation, not directly connected to Epstein.

connections.description: Supervisory/professional relationship where the Regional Director requests and receives operational updates on inmate Epstein from the Associate Warden.
The Associate Warden is responsible for the custody and status updates of inmate Epstein at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein removed from Suicide Watch
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and stepped down to Psychological Observation status at MCC New York. He was escorted for a medical assessment and then to an attorney conference.

events.title: Epstein placed on Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein was placed on Psychological Observation, a temporary status for inmates with impaired mental status or functioning, pending reassessment the next day.

events.title: Pending incident report for Self-Mutilation
events.description: Epstein had a pending incident report for Self-Mutilation, which dictated his return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) to be celled with another inmate.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was removed from suicide watch and placed on 'Psychological Observation' status at MCC New York.
Epstein had a pending incident report for 'Self-Mutilation,' which required his return to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The email defines 'Psychological Observation' as a temporary status for inmates with deteriorating mental status who are not imminently suicidal but have unpredictable behavior.
The email chain shows Bureau of Prisons officials closely monitoring Epstein's status and housing conditions less than three weeks before his death.
A separate inmate, Cesar Sayoc, is mentioned as an example of an SHU inmate, but this is not directly related to Epstein's case.
